segments.text: Guess what ! I know something you don't know !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: How many planets are there in the solar system ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's easy . Everyone knows that there are nine .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Not anymore ! Can you believe it ? They've decided that Pluto is not a planet anymore !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Nice try . I wasn't born yesterday , you know .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'm dead serious . They've decided that it's too small to be a planet , but actually they haven't yet agreed on how big something has to be in order to be a planet anymore .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That sounds crazy . But they can't just change their mind about things like that .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , they can . If you remember correctly , people used to believe that the world was flat .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I suppose you're right . They also used to think that they were so important that the sun revolved around them , not the other way around .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: We actually know relatively little about space and the cosmos .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do you think that we'll one day be able to travel to another planet for a vacation ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I suppose we could actually live on a planet outside of the milky way .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do you think we'll ever get to meet an alien from outer space ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I hope not . I think they would be a threat to those of us that lived on the Earth .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You're so old-fashioned . That's what people used to think about people from another country !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Point taken . Hopefully one day , we'll live in an interplanetary society .
segments.speaker: S1
